unnormalised: Rental Agreements Getting a Makeover, Mumbai Dwellers Rejoice!
normalised: Rental Agreements Getting a Makeover, Mumbai Dwellers Rejoice!

unnormalised: Forget those complicated, lawyer-speak rental agreements of yore! Seems like the registration office near Bandra is finally catching up with the times. They're rolling out simplified formats, making it easier for tenants and landlords to seal the deal.
normalised: Forget those complicated, lawyer-speak rental agreements of yore! Seems like the registration office near Bandra is finally catching up with the times. They are rolling out simplified formats, making it easier for tenants and landlords to seal the deal.

unnormalised: Remember that scene from "Bunty aur Babli" where they're struggling with legal documents? Well, hopefully, such hassles will be a thing of the past. No more running around like crazy for stamp duty!
normalised: Remember that scene from "Bunty aur Babli" where they are struggling with legal documents? Well, hopefully, such hassles will be a thing of the past. No more running around like crazy for stamp duty!

unnormalised: According to sources at the National Housing Bank (NHB), the updated agreements will be shorter, clearer, and more focused on key aspects like rent amount (Rs. 25,000/month average in Andheri, BTW!), security deposit (usually 2-3 months' rent), and maintenance responsibilities.
normalised: According to sources at the N H B, the updated agreements will be shorter, clearer, and more focused on key aspects like rent amount (rupees twenty five thousand per month average in Andheri, B T W!), security deposit (usually two to three months' rent), and maintenance responsibilities.

unnormalised: Word on the street is that online registration processes are also getting a revamp. Less paperwork, more chai breaks! The aim is to promote fair practices and reduce disputes. Renting in Mumbai just got a little less stressful! Let's hope this extends to finding a decent 1BHK near CST that doesn't cost an arm and a leg! And remember to always read the fine print, even if it's simplified!
normalised: Word on the street is that online registration processes are also getting a revamp. Less paperwork, more chai breaks! The aim is to promote fair practices and reduce disputes. Renting in Mumbai just got a little less stressful! Let us hope this extends to finding a decent one B H K near C S T that does not cost an arm and a leg! And remember to always read the fine print, even if it is simplified!
